page.title: 11Centenary celebrations cont.
page.content: In June there was another centenary service celebrating the official opening of the parish church in 1885.Many past clergymen of Dalton attended.They were joined by men from our parish who had been ordained into the priesthood and who live elsewhere. The uniformed organisations were in church as well.The retired Bishop of Carlisle preached the sermon.After the service all the clergy,the mayor and mayoress and the P.C.C.had lunch in the church centre. Dalton Church of England School also held a centenary service.First the infants explained a hundred.The headmaster read some exerts from the school log book from 1885. The lower juniors did a sketch going back in time to see how long a church had been in Dalton. There has been a church here since at least 1085.
